description: A 2nd CE to 6th CE enclosed settlement or 'round'. It included a polygonal structure set up-hill from the rest of the settlement, showing no domestic activity, but having a gap in the floor interpreted as a space for deposits.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Tremough, Penryn (Site 3) (Cornwall).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Quinnell. “Excavations at Trethurgy Round, St Austell: Community and Status in Roman and Post-Roman Cornwall.” Oxford Archaeology Monograph, 2004.
